comments: This may be related to the recent Buzilla upgrade on the EclipseCon site, but http://www.eclipsecon.org/2006/ is not working.

Unfortunately, there was an attack on the EclipseCon 2006 website (which runs Tomcat) and it was reasonably successful and so the site will remain down (sigh) until at least next month when it comes up to the top of the webmaster@ queue. Sorry about that.

An attack? I am all ears.  Can you provide me with all the details?  As far as I know, this happened as soon as Tomcat was restarted Tuesday.

D.

I keep getting lots of these in catalina.out:

I also saw a whole bunch of these, until Sept. 19th (when Tomcat went awry):

18-Sep-06 4:46:09 PM  _ZN4java4lang9ThrowableC1EPNS0_6StringE
SEVERE: Exception invoking periodic operation:
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/data/httpd/eclipsecon.org/www/eclipsecon_2006/WEB-INF/lib/avalon-framework-4.1.5.jar (Too many open files)
The site is back up now.
